intro: Chiococca brachiata var. acuminata, commonly known as the acuminata chiococca, is a climbing vine native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its twining stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. The fruits are capsule-like structures that contain numerous small, hard seeds.
